bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to W.L. Holman, January 7, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Holman, a former professor of his, for the compliments on his article.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to W.L. Holman, January 7, 1942
div1.opener:
January 7, 1942
Dr. W. L. Holman
Department of Pathology and Bacteriology
University of Toronto
The Banting Institute
Toronto, Canada
My dear Doctor Holman:
div1.p:
I appreciate indeed your kind words about my
paper on “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”. Especially is
it nice to receive words of commendation from a former
professor. You may remember that I was your student
at the University of Pittsburgh, class of 1920. I
thought you would prefer to have the original version
rather than the one as printed in the Proceedings. How-
ever, the latter is a little more full than the Hygeia
one; therefore, I am sending you both. Should you care
for more, I should be glad to send them.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
